About

I’m Jean (pronounced Jean as in Jean Luc Picard). I’m originally from South Africa (Cape Town area), but I’ve lived in England (Hertfordshire) and Sweden (Stockholm) before moving to the US. I originally moved to Raleigh, North Carolina, where I attended North Carolina State University for Math and Computer Science. Now I live in the best state in the USA - Colorado!

I work on:

  • Client libraries for GCP: I lead broad iniatives like reliability and performance.
  • Go client libraries for GCP: I am the lead maintainer of the Go client libraries for GCP.
  • Go: I contribute to the Go project primarily in tooling, modules, and documentation.

I’ve also worked on grpc-go and Google Drive.

Outside of work, I enjoy reading sci-fi and fantasy, climbing, mountain biking, skiing, learning languages (French right now!), cooking, and spending time with my wonderful Colorado community.

You can usually find me on the Gophers Slack under the ID deklerk.
